keyword: how many calories are in a peanut butter jelly sandwich
title: How Many Calories in a Peanut Butter Jelly Sandwich?
meta_description: Discover how many calories are in a peanut butter jelly sandwich, including full nutrition breakdown, macros, and easy tweaks for variations.
h1: How Many Calories in a Peanut Butter Jelly Sandwich?
assumptions: 2 slices white bread, 2 tbsp creamy peanut butter, 1 tbsp grape jelly; no added butter or extras.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by bread type, peanut butter brand, jelly amount, and preparation. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: A standard peanut butter jelly sandwich has about 400 kcal, with 13 g protein and 50 g carbs.

label_note: Values mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with packaged foods.

tweaks.label: Use whole wheat bread instead of white

faqs.q: How many calories are in a peanut butter jelly sandwich?
faqs.a: Approximately 400 kcal for a standard version with 2 slices white bread, 2 tbsp peanut butter, and 1 tbsp jelly.

faqs.q: What's the protein in a PB&J sandwich?
faqs.a: About 13 g, mostly from the peanut butter.

faqs.q: Does a peanut butter jelly sandwich have a lot of sugar?
faqs.a: Yes, around 20 g from the jelly and bread; opt for low-sugar jelly to reduce.

faqs.q: How to lower calories in a PB&J?
faqs.a: Use thinner bread slices, natural peanut butter, or less jelly to cut 50-100 kcal.

faqs.q: Are PB&J sandwiches high in fat?
faqs.a: Moderately, with 16 g total fat (3 g saturated) from peanut butter; choose low-fat versions if needed.
